DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Liver Disease Quality of Life Index Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The complete text of an individual questionnaire on the quality of life index for participants with chronic liver disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Liver Disease Quality of Life Index
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number for a disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time of the liver.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:Any disease or dysfunction of the liver and the intrahepatic bile ducts.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.

Concepts.longName: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver parenchyma and intrahepatic bile ducts. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and polycystic liver disease. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, lymphoma, and angiosarcoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredName: Chronic Liver Disease Quality of Life Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text to describe the content of an chronic liver disease questionnaire question for a clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
